metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6555 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The irda_setsockopt function in net/irda/af_irda.c and later indrivers/staging/irda/net/af_irda.c in the Linux kernel before 4.17 allowslocal users to cause a denial of service (ias_object use-after-free andsystem crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via an AF_IRDAsocket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6555` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-36-generic - 4.15.0-36.39
linux-image-4.15.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-36.39
linux-image-4.15.0-36-lowlatency - 4.15.0-36.39
linux-image-4.15.0-36-snapdragon - 4.15.0-36.39
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-36-generic - 4.15.0-36.39
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-36-lowlatency - 4.15.0-36.39
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1024-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1024.26
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1023-aws - 4.15.0-1023.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1025-azure - 4.15.0-1025.26
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1021-gcp - 4.15.0-1021.22
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1023-kvm - 4.15.0-1023.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1021-oem - 4.15.0-1021.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-36.39').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1024.26').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.23').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1025.26').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1021.22').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.23').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1021.24').
